answers.answer: Look instead for asthma and allergies.

It is definitely cause for concern.  He needs to have respiratory testing like spirometry or a full pulmonary function test done.  You should also request heart testing.Seeing a pulmonologist (lung doctor) and a cardiologist may be good ideas since his doctor doesn't seem to be very interested in finding the problem.God bless.

question: my son complains he is dizzy and holds his chest and has a hard time breathing. This has happened about 6 times in the last3-4 months but it seems like it is happening more often what could this be?...he has had blood work done to rule out any of the obvious. diabetes, enemia etc.
title: Is there cause for concern?
